meanings.definition: The act or process of converting text from one script into another script.
meanings.sent1: I practiced my transliteration by writing English words in Japanese characters.
meanings.sent2: The website offers a transliteration service for those who want to convert their names into Arabic script.
meanings.sent3: During the language class, we had a fun competition to see who could do the best transliteration of a French poem.
meanings.sent4: Her transliteration of the ancient text brought new life to the words, making them easier to understand.
meanings.sent5: The artist's unique transliteration of the traditional calligraphy style caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: A system of representing letters or characters of one alphabet in the corresponding characters of another alphabet.
meanings.sent1: The transliteration of Greek letters into Latin characters helped me understand the ancient text better.
meanings.sent2: In some languages, transliteration is necessary to accurately pronounce foreign words.
meanings.sent3: The secret code was simply a clever transliteration of the alphabet.
meanings.sent4: Her transliteration of the symbols into English letters revealed a hidden message.
meanings.sent5: The transliteration of the hieroglyphics into modern script was a challenging task for the archaeologists.
